title.narrative: Freedom of Religion and Belief - The Netherlands

description.narrative: For connecting voices the target groups are: like-minded authorities, organisations and institutions; local and national government bodies; European Union, United Nations. Capacity building and Linking & Learning: partnerorganisations of Mensen met een Missie.
In The Netherlands Mensen met een Missie and BBO are the implementing organisations.

The activities carried out in the Netherlands contribute to the goal of connecting voices. The aim is to establish links and cooperative relationships among relevant actors at the local, national and international levels to build a broad support base for freedom of religion and belief, and a more effectively lobby for legal and policy reform. Other objectives of the activities that are carried out in the Netherlands are: capacity building and linking & learning. These last two objectives are mainly reached trough partner consultations and work visits. To increase knowledge on the subject of Freedom of Religion and Belief research has been conducted and a position paper will be written.

participating-org.narrative: BBO - BBO bv has a track record of twenty years in support and advise to civil society organisations working in the field of international cooperation. The BBO advisors are experts in political decision making and the policy debate in Europe, and are experienced brokers between civil society organisations and political decision-makers.
